subject: Re: Methods that does not return value
msgSnippet: Rick, I tried leaving out com.ibm.uvm.tools.DebugSupport from classpath but then what happens, it throws a class not found exception and still doesn t return
messageBody:
Rick,

I tried leaving out com.ibm.uvm.tools.DebugSupport from classpath but
then what happens, it throws a class not found exception and still
doesn't return true.

Thanks,

Lily.


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Rick Berman <rick.berman@a...> wrote:
> Lily,
>
> Maybe I missed something from earlier in this thread,
> but I'm not sure why you *want* the inVAJava() call to
> return true when you're outside of VAJ. I'm not a VAJ
> user but a quick look at the sources for Junit 3.8.1
> suggests that the only thing this method really
> controls is some automatic class reloading behavior.
>
> As your test program shows, inVAJava() is *correctly*
> answering that it is not running in VAJ when you're
> outside of VAJ. It would seem to me that instead of
> finding a way to have more of VAJ present, you'd be
> looking to *not* have com.ibm.uvm.tools.DebugSupport
> present in your classpath. If it wasn't there, the
> attempt to load it in inVAJava() will just report that
> it isn't there rather than leaving you with problems
> loading other clasess the DebugSupport appears to be
> trying to load.
>
> Rick
>
> --- ok_lilya <lilya.jangirov@r...> wrote:
> > Hello,
> >
> > I do NOT export JUnit from VAJ. Where it fails, is
> > in that call to
> > Class.forName("com.ibm.uvm.tools.DebugSupport");
> >
> > Like I said,
> > I created a very small program that only contains
> > inVAJava() method
> > and a main that calls it:
> > public static boolean inVAJava() {
> > try {
> > Class.forName("com.ibm.uvm.tools.DebugSupport");
> > }
> > catch (Exception e) {
> > return false;
> > }
> > return true;
> > }
> >
> > main... {
> > if (inVajava())
> > System.out.println("true");
> > else
> > System.out.println("false");
> > }
> >
> > It alsways returns false because of that call to a
> > vative IBM java
> > class.
> >
> > Thanks,
> >
> > Lily.
> >
> >
> >
